content:
Post484 said
What is my problem???

Probably your antivirus if you have 300+ copies of that single file. You can delete all of the copies of the file with a number and you probably need an exception in your antivirus program for the Thunderbird profile folder to stop it scanning in that folder while Thunderbird is running.
creator: MattAuSupport

Your preference is not relevant here. It is not something you have control over.

If you want to offer feedback about the customization, or lack of, I suggest you use the feedback link on thunderbird's help menu. content: If the old profile is still there, you might look in the folders at c:\users\<yourid>\appdata\roaming\thunderbird\profiles The addressbook is abook.sqlite
creator: davidsk

content:
YOU are not using a service that is synchronized to the server storage. So even the read/unread status of email is synchronized. I suggest you get used to getting mail when it arrives, not when you click a button.

I still use POP because for some accounts it meets my needs better than IMAP. avoid exchange and the OWL add-on if at all possible as emulating the exchange web services is not something I want to be doing much of..
creator: MattAuSupport

content: Well I click on the headers at the top of the message list to sort by the heading named. A second click reverses the sort order.
creator: MattAuSupport

content:
pdf.js (https://mozilla.github.io/pdf.js/) è la libreria di Thunderbird che visualizza i PDF. Questa libreria converte il formato PDF in un suo equivalente HTML che poi è visualizzato da Thunderbird. Con file PDF semplici la conversione è praticamente perfetta. Con file PDF con caratteristiche tecniche o grafiche avanzante invece possono esserci delle imperfezioni come quella che hai descritto.

Non esiste una soluzione se non quella di attendere gli aggiornamenti di pdf.js. Oppure puoi impostare un diverso programma per aprire i PDF, perdendo però la comodità del visualizzatore integrato.
creator: @next

content: Tasks as you appear to be seeking to use them only work with Google calendar and tasks. Then only if you use the provider for Google calendar add-on from the add-on site to setup the account. So you need to install it first before adding the account/calendar

content:
I just had the same issue!

I downgraded Thunderbird using the following commands. The mask command is needed so it wont be auto-updated by Discover or Gnome Software

sudo flatpak update --commit=2151b1e101f1266d135040c142f4c36a7e3373dc772e75a509a38efc39ded993 org.mozilla.Thunderbird flatpak mask org.mozilla.Thunderbird
creator: me449
